sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Tennis star Novak Djokovic has arrived in Dubai after being deported from Australia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: His departure marks the end of his hopes of defending his Australian Open title and the prestigious tournament has now already begun.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In a brief statement, the Serb stated he was deeply disappointed and that he will take time to recuperate before making further comments.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: His home country supported him throughout the ordeal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: President Aleksandar Vucic even said he felt the star had been harassed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Messages of support were put on a giant illuminated billboard in Belgrade.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The 11-day saga saw the unvaccinated player's visa revoked, reinstated, then revoked again by immigration minister Alex Hawke. vaccinated players visa revoked, reinstated, then revoked again by Immigration Minister Alex Hawke.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In the end, three judges unanimously upheld the decision to cancel Djokovic's visa because his presence might risk civil unrest by stoking anti-vaccination sentiment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: US President Joe Biden has called a hostage-taking incident at a synagogue in Texas on Saturday an act of terror.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The FBI identified the assailant as a 44-year-old British citizen named Malik Faisal Akram.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The incident lasted 12 hours until he was shot dead and all four victims were released unhurt.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: This was an act of terror. This was an act of terror. And it not only was related to someone who had been arrested, I might add, 15 years ago and been in jail for 10 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The idea was it was something new. And they did just a great job.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In a tweet, British Foreign Minister Liz Truss also condemned the hostage-taking, writing, ''We stand with the US in defending the rights and freedoms of our citizens against those who spread hate.� The suspect�s motive is unknown, but he appeared to be seeking the release of a convicted terrorist.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Law enforcement officials are investigating if he was listed on terrorist databases or had mental health issues.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Police in England are helping and have arrested two people in Greater Manchester.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: No vaccine, no cafe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: French lawmakers have swept a controversial bill through Parliament introducing the vaccine pass.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: After much resistance from both the left and the right, 215 deputies out of a total of 280 voted in favour of the measure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: From Monday, unvaccinated people over the age of 60 in Greece will need to pay a fine every month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The decision comes as the country's public health system struggles to cope with an increase in cases.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: However, the lack of available appointments have left some people feeling frustrated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This man says, I booked an appointment on the 11th of January in order to get vaccinated, but the authorities only offered me an appointment from the 31st of January.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Why didn't they give me an appointment earlier?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It's not my fault, but now they say I should pay a fine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Why?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Austria will become the first European country to make Covid-19 vaccinations compulsory for all adults from February. The newly appointed Chancellor, Karl Niehammer, says it's a sensitive subject, but those who don't comply will face a hefty fine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: There will be an introductory phase to give people the opportunity to be vaccinated, to be convinced.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, thousands of people marched peacefully through the Dutch city of Amsterdam on Sunday to protest the government's coronavirus lockdown measures. While the country has been under strict lockdown since December 19th, non-essential stores can now reopen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: France's parliaments voted to transform the current Covid health pass into a vaccine pass.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This means that to go to a cafe like this one, a restaurant, a cinema, or to take a train, you'll have to prove that you're vaccinated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Showing a negative test or proof of a recent infection will no longer be enough.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The change is expected to take effect later this week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It comes after two weeks of wrangling in Parliament, including a row over whether giving restaurants the power to check their customers' IDs breaches civil liberties. And all of this is happening as the current health passes are beginning to expire for people who haven't had booster jabs. Thousands of demonstrators marched against the vaccine pass across the country on Saturday, but their numbers were far smaller than they were the previous weekend.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: More than nine in ten adults in France are vaccinated, but there's still a surge in infections, although the Omicron variant appears less dangerous.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Many of those in hospital are unvaccinated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Former President Petro Poroshenko is heading back to Ukraine despite facing charges of high

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: treason in the country. Poroshenko said Sunday that he is returning to fight those charges, even though he views them as politically motivated Poroshenko was defeated by current president Volodymyr Zelensky in 2019 after five years in office at a news conference in Warsaw hours before his flight to Kiev he said he feels confident he won't be arrested me if I could be arrested definitely not not because I'm so confident, because I have no absolutely zero reason for that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And I hate the idea, and I think that Zelenskyy make a shoot in their legs that at the current situation Zelenskyy will do these things. But once again, I return to Ukraine to fight for Ukraine, not to fight for the civilians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Poroshenko fled Ukraine in December 2021 after being accused of helping pro-Russian separatists sell coal to Kiev.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: If convicted, he faces up to 15 years in prison.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Serbia's bid to join the European Union has moved a step closer after a referendum backed

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: constitutional amendments required for admission to the bloc. Just over 60% of voters in the Balkan nation opted to approve a constitutional amendment to depoliticize the election of judges and prosecutors. The government stressed the change was needed to strengthen the rule of law through an independent judiciary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: With this result we have sent a very positive message to the world. I believe that in the coming period we will manage to develop something for our country regarding further democratization.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: I think we did a good thing for our country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In a country where the judiciary is widely seen as corrupt and politically controlled, the result's been hailed by the European Union, the US and some other Western countries as a step in the right direction.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: However, some critics at home say the changes don't go far enough.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Stricken fishing boats in New Zealand and Japan are testimony to the force of the tsunami wave that hit the Pacific on Saturday, but the extent of the damage on the island of Tonga remains unclear because of communication difficulties. The New Zealand embassy in Nuku'alofa has been a rare source of news. Official damage assessments are not yet available.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: However, our High Commission in Tonga advised the tsunami has had a significant impact on the foreshore on the northern side of Nuku'alofa with boats and large boulders washed ashore.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Shops along the coast have been damaged and a significant clean-up will be needed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Volcanic dust from the undersea eruption has reportedly polluted the water supply on Tonga, which was hit by waves of around 80 centimetres.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The island's only internet connection runs underwater to Fiji and has been lost.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Who are the contenders to win the Australian Open? Now that the men's number one Novak Djokovic will no longer compete, who may take his title?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The Spaniard Rafael Nadal is starting his 20th season and hasn't won the tournament since 2009.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Russian player Daniil Medvedev is currently ranked world number two by the Association of Tennis Professionals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The 25-year-old was also the runner-up at last year's tournament.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: World number three and Olympic gold medalist Alexander Zverev is looking to get his first Grand Slam.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Greek player Stefanos Tsitsipas is the third youngest player in the top 10.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: He has already made records by becoming the highest ranked Greek player in history.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: As for the female players, singles world number one Ashley Barty is keen to take the title.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: She has promised to give it her best crack.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And finally defending champion Naomi Osaka, the four-time Grand Slam champion and the first Asian player to hold the number one ranking, will be looking to retain the title.
